medical_history.chief_complaint: Progressive encephalitis or meningoencephalitis leading to death.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms began in late 2011, with a duration of 2 to 4 months before death. Initial symptoms included fever, shivers, psychomotor slowing, confusion, unsteady gait, myoclonus, and ocular paresis. Symptoms progressed to coma.
medical_history.social_history: All three patients were breeders of variegated squirrels and had contact with the animals, including bites and scratches.
